text: Harry what is Alan here today I will be
making a very flavorful yes
easy and simple appetizer it can be
served as a drinking snack during
football games or parties is called
hands up and jam or baby clams with rice
crackers let's begin
giving it about 4 to 500 grams
baby clams you can buy it frozen or in a
can at Asian store they are quite big
compared to the ones in Vietnam which is
really tiny put it into a strainer to
drain off the excess water
you also need 1 package of rum or
Vietnamese mint
it has a strong peppery taste and will
have to reduce the fishy smell of the
clams remove the stems rinse well and
chop them up slide 1 medium onion
lengthwise into thin wedges hit a
tablespoon of vegetable oil in a wok and
saute some whitewash spring onion and
garlic mint until fragrant you can also
add lemongrass if you want you then add
the clams and stir well on high heat
then add about a teaspoon of chicken or
pork stock some freshly cracked pepper
and cayenne pepper to add some heat stir
well again then add the slight onion and
keep mixing until is withered and turns
translucent finally adding some fish
sauce turn off the heat then add the
chopped Vietnamese mint give it a final
toss and we are done transfer to a
serving plate garnish with some crushed
peanuts and fried shallots you can buy
the system in rice crackers in a package
like this just put it in a microwave 1
minute per side and you will get a nice
crackers like this you can also grill it
in the oven with the broiler on to serve
break a piece of rice cracker and use it
at the spoon to scoop the baby clams
it's a perfect snack for drinking if you
liked this video don't forget to click
like and subscribe to my channel for
more delicious Vietnamese
thank you for watching bye-bye
[Music]
